title: Zilon
author: Zilon
content: If Bitcoin eventually falls to a price where every one begins to panic can you guess what the headline will look like in your own country. I was thinking on preparing the minds of new investors because truth be told the newsletters will stir up FOMO and FUD but as a community of crypto investors staying mindful of the expected outcome should be a necessity.We could get funny captions like "Bitcoin Finally crashed", or something even more terrifying like "Investors losses their assets to Bitcoin despite Government warns". staying up to date with the routine and structure of the law of supply and demand will be a good way to treat the news eventually the price of Bitcoin becomes even more scary

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Normally when Bitcoin dips, abnormal Nigerians on social media (especially Facebook) utilize that opportunity to lampoon those of us who are in the crypto industry. I read their comments and shake my head at their ignorance. I've gone passed that age of caring anyone. It was in 2018 that their jabs gave me a second thought about this industry as I was virtually new then. Now, I'm made of steel. I know Bitcoin won't disappear that way. Various financial institutions and governments know that. If ignorant individuals refuse to up their knowledge on Bitcoin, that's their kettle of fish and their loss.Even if I get to read, "Bitcoin finally dies" or in a worse scenario "Bitcoin, the world antichrist" I will be the least moved.

comments.author: CryptocurencyKing
comments.body: Moments like this becomes very daring for young investors but, not for people like me. Altcoins I might be scared of but not bitcoin, nope not at all. I have never imagined it and hope not to entertain any fear passed around but to say the least, some detestful headlines and bloggers are sure to make the most of them.Let me try dropping just a few;"Satoshi finally takes profit""Satoshi Bitcoin is finally dead""The bitcoin scheme that started over a decade ago is finally dead""Bitcoin, the biggest fraud of all time"There would be lost of these¬† but the truth is, bitcoin isn't crashing. Its just the other side of the market of the market that we aren't so pleased with playing out #Bear market. Suck it up!

comments.author: Rockstarguy
comments.body: This is a time I have been waiting to see,¬† some people don't know times like this is also important to some people the way it is also important to others when the market is bullish. People should learn to expect every¬† moment of bitcoin and not to feel panic when it goes dip unexpected. I always tell beginners if they can't stay placid when the market goes dip their is no need to invest in bitcoin, like it is always said if you don't deserve a dip you also don't deserve the bull.

comments.author: AakZaki
comments.body: a market crash like this is making the FUD caption stronger, there will be many captions or news headlines about bitcoin's misfortune which is in a bearish state. Those who start to panic will only destroy their minds, because they use their savings to buy bitcoins.but on the other hand when the market is crashing like now, some people use this opportunity to buy gradually and wait until the bullish time is reached. the market won't crash forever, there will be where FOMO happens and it becomes a bull market.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: The "bitcoin is dead" FUD is old and is not regularly used anymore, they've long come up with new FUD which we are already seeing which is trying to fool people into believing a big lie: "bitcoin crashed because US stock market crashed" and we have to get used to seeing this FUD for a couple of more years until people start seeing the truth and go back to what they were doing in the past 13 years which was to buy bitcoin whenever US stock market crashed.

comments.body: The media in my country is already actively following all these events in the crypto market and the comments, including the front pages, are very catastrophic and negative about the crypto.It is mostly mentioned that a lot of naive people invested in crypto in hopes of getting rich and crypto fell to less than a third of its value in less than 2 years, so they all lost big money.Of course, the media are happy to mention that criminals also like to use cryptocurrency due to anonymity, and that crypto is not regulated and legally protected.Caption?Maybe somedthing like this: The crypto has collapsed, millions of people have lost their life savings. The biggest scam of the century!

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: People are finally seeing Bitcoin as the ponzi scheme it is, or something along those lines is something I saw when the whole Celsius circus began. I don't really pay attention to mass media headlines but you see them anyways one way or the other. They are just trying to sell whatever can be sold and right now it's Bitcoin crashing and destroying everything in its path.  Is it better to be uninformed or misinformed, that's the real question?

comments.body: Actually, I don't mind it whatever caption they give to bitcoin if it keeps on falling down.The media has already given a lot of bad captions for bitcoin and nothing new will happen even if they make another captaion and headline that will trigger every bitcoin investor just for the sake of their contents.Fundamentally, bitcoin has achieved a lot of things on this current cycle and the media won't even publish it.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: There are a lot of bad captions when the Bitcoin price drop and this isn't new, everytime when there's a downtime on Bitcoin, haters will always have that kind of negative caption or media give negative headlines which they think becomes more catchy to the eys of the readers, it seems "oops, eyes on here".¬† I didn't surprise if there is, but the true thing is with us true Bitcoin enthusiasts which truly understand how Bitcoin will work, and during a downtrend, we know that it will recover soon. But when there's a new ATH will come, what common headlines that we heard?¬† "It is time to buy Bitcoin" "invest Bitcoin now" which is we know that they're in the wrong decision.¬† IMO, let them be.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on June 13, 2022, 01:41:52 AMnewsletters will stir up FOMO and FUD...This happens to be a specialty of media houses, and what we can expect from them, the hype and twisted captions they can give to a situation mostly to increase their audience. People who do not bother getting a detailed story/report of a situation and just skim through headlines fall prey these captions from newsletters the most.If it is a government controlled media house, the captions you may get will mostly be in favour of the government, such as; - Government CBDC's, a better option than failing bitcoins.- Investors Ignore Government Warnings, Suffer as Crypto Bleeds.If it is a media house free from government influence, the captions are more likely to provoke you into questioning your decision to Hodl. Captions like;- Crypto too unpredictable, not a good investment afterall.
